alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 24 at 11:24PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kansas, including the following county, Lyon. * WHEN...Until 230 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1123 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Emporia and Olpe. - This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 133 and 135.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
